page.title: 10TELFORD JOB TRAINING
page.content: In Telford there are nine major building firms. One of the major industries in the town, encouraged by the Telford Development Corporation, is the building of new houses and the refurbishment of old properties. Yet with the recession firms are often reluctant to train young workers. In response to this, the Telford Youth Training Agency, has recently been given new life. It is located in converted premises, by Lawley roundabout. 60 youths, aged 16, are being taken on, financed by the Man- Power Services Commission, and given training in the skills of a 'construction worker'. For two weekly stints they train in the Lawley workshop, and then spend the same time working on a real job, using those skills, for example, refurbishing an old building, selected by the TDC.
